body_html:
And you're listing the file as it is inside the sandbox (not in the repo)?

For odd build issues like this it tends to be fastest just to reclone the repo.

git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git
cd tensorflow/
cat ~/WORKSPACE_ANDROID >> WORKSPACE 
bazel build //tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo

Where my WORKSPACE_ANDROID file contains the following (adjust for your system):

android_sdk_repository(
    name = "androidsdk",
    api_level = 23,
    build_tools_version = "23.0.1",
    # Replace with path to Android SDK on your system
    path = "/usr/local/google/home/andrewharp/android/sdk",
)

android_ndk_repository(
    name="androidndk",
    path="/usr/local/google/home/andrewharp/android/ndk",
    api_level=21)

body:
And you're listing the file as it is inside the sandbox (not in the repo)?

For odd build issues like this it tends to be fastest just to reclone the repo.

```
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git
cd tensorflow/
cat ~/WORKSPACE_ANDROID >> WORKSPACE 
bazel build //tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo
```

Where my WORKSPACE_ANDROID file contains the following (adjust for your system):
```
android_sdk_repository(
    name = "androidsdk",
    api_level = 23,
    build_tools_version = "23.0.1",
    # Replace with path to Android SDK on your system
    path = "/usr/local/google/home/andrewharp/android/sdk",
)

android_ndk_repository(
    name="androidndk",
    path="/usr/local/google/home/andrewharp/android/ndk",
    api_level=21)
```
